Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.matrixblock

Class MatrixBlockInfo

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.matrixblock.MatrixBlockInfo
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class MatrixBlockInfo extends Object implements Serializable
Defines a square matrix as a set of square blocks used by the Out-Of-Core (OOC) Cholesky decomposition and inversion object LSINV. This object maintains the definition and provides static input/output functionality to read and write the blocks from/to a file.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • MatrixBlockInfo

      public MatrixBlockInfo​(int size, int blksize)
      Creates a new MatrixBlockInfo object for a matrix of row/column size (square) with blocks of blksize rows/columns (note blksize <= size).
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the matrix (rows/columns square) represented by this new MatrixBlockInfo object.
      blksize - The size of the matrix (rows/columns square) contained in a single block of the matrix.

    • MatrixBlockInfo

      public MatrixBlockInfo​(String fPath) throws IOException
      Creates a new MatrixBlockInfo object from the file definition contained in the file at fPath.
      Parameters:
      fPath - The file that contains the new definition for this MatrixBlockInfo object.
      Throws:
      IOException

  • Method Details

    • getMaxBlockRows

      public int getMaxBlockRows​(int blkrow)
      Returns the number of rows/columns saved in the block with index blkrow. This value is always aBlkSize, except when blkrow equals the last block row index, in which case it can range from 1 to aBlkSize depending on if the number of matrix rows is an integer multiple of aSize.
      Parameters:
      blkrow - The block index for which the number of rows in the block will be returned.
      Returns:
      The number of matrix rows/columns contained in the block whose row index is blkrow.

    • getMaxLastBlockRows

      public int getMaxLastBlockRows()
      Returns the number of rows/columns saved in the block with index blkrow. This value is always aBlkSize, except when blkrow equals the last block row index, in which case it can range from 1 to aBlkSize depending on if the number of matrix rows is an integer multiple of aSize.
      Parameters:
      blkrow - The block index for which the number of rows in the block will be returned.
      Returns:
      The number of matrix rows/columns contained in the block whose row index is blkrow.

    • getBlockIndex

      public int getBlockIndex​(int mtrxrow)
      Returns the block index that contains the input matrix row/column.
      Parameters:
      mtrxrow - The input matrix row for which its containing block index will be returned.
      Returns:
      The block index that contains the input matrix row/column index.

    • getBlockIndexPlus1

      public int getBlockIndexPlus1​(int mtrxrow)
      Returns the block index that contains the input matrix row/column. If the input row/column exceeds the number of entries then the number of available blocks is returned (which is one larger than the last valid block index).
      Parameters:
      mtrxrow - The input matrix row for which its containing block index will be returned.
      Returns:
      The block index that contains the input matrix row/column index. If the input row/column exceeds the number of entries then the number of available blocks is returned (which is one larger than the last valid block index).

    • readBlock

      public static double[][] readBlock​(int iB, int jB, MatrixBlockInfo mbi, String fPath, boolean trnsps) throws IOException
      Reads and returns the matrix block stored in the file fPath_iB_jB, where fPath, iB, and jB are filled with their input string equivalents. The integers iB and jB represent the block row and column index. The input MatrixBlockInfo object (mbi) contains the size information of the total matrix being input from fPath. This function reads the block in transposed fashion so as not to have to iterate over the row index in the inner loop.
      Parameters:
      iB - The block row index of the block to be read.
      jB - The block column index of the block to be read.
      mbi - The MatrixBlockInfo object containing the size information of the total matrix.
      fPath - The path from which the matrix block will be read with a final file name of fPath_iB_jB.
      trnsps - Read the matrix in transpose fashion if true.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • writeBlock

      public static void writeBlock​(double[][] blk, int iB, int jB, MatrixBlockInfo mbi, String fPath, boolean trnsps) throws IOException
      Writes the input matrix block (blk) to a file fPath_iB_jB, where fPath, iB, and jB are filled with their input string equivalents. The integers iB and jB represent the block row and column index. The input MatrixBlockInfo object (mbi) contains the size information of the total matrix being output to fPath. This function writes the input block in transposed fashion so as not to have to iterate over the row index in the inner loop.
      Parameters:
      blk - The matrix grid block to be output.
      iB - The block row index of the block to be written.
      jB - The block column index of the block to be written.
      mbi - The MatrixBlockInfo object containing the size information of the total matrix.
      fPath - The path to where the matrix block will be written with a final file name of fPath_iB_jB.
      trnsps - Write the matrix in transpose fashion if true.
      Throws:
      IOException
